item.title: The pros and cons of PSA tests for prostate cancer for midlife and older men
item.description: With Biden's prostate cancer in the news, men may be wondering whether and at what age to be screened. Advice about the value PSA tests has fluctuated...

item.title: First FDA-cleared Alzheimer's blood test could make diagnoses faster, more accurate
item.description: The first Alzheimer's blood test cleared by the Food And Drug Administration is poised to change the way doctors diagnose and treat the disease.

item.title: 'Which is it?' RFK Jr. waffles on cuts to lead poisoning prevention efforts
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. faced tough questions from senators about a lead poisoning crisis in public schools in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

item.title: A salmonella outbreak sickens dozens, prompting a cucumber recall. Here's what to do
item.description: The FDA says 26 people, nine of whom were hospitalized, have gotten sick across 15 states. It is still figuring out where the cucumbers were distribut...

item.title: Diseases are spreading. The CDC isn't warning the public like it was months ago
item.description: Some of the CDC's main channels for communicating urgent health information to the public have gone silent.
